Dataset input.title: Dataset input
Dataset input.description: Dataset input using nf-tower "dataset" or "data explorer". Allows for the input of multiple         parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel.

param_list.description: Dataset input can either be a list of maps, a csv file, a json file, a yaml file, or simply a yaml                 blob. The names of the input fields (e.g. csv columns, json keys) need to be an exact match with the workflow input parameters.

input.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `pbmc_1k_protein_v3_raw_feature_bc_matrix.h5`. An h5 file from the 10x genomics website
input.help_text: Type: `file`, required, example: `pbmc_1k_protein_v3_raw_feature_bc_matrix.h5`. An h5 file from the 10x genomics website.

output.description: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output.h5`, example: `pbmc_1k_protein_v3_raw_feature_bc_matrix_filtered.h5`. Output h5 file
output.help_text: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output.h5`, example: `pbmc_1k_protein_v3_raw_feature_bc_matrix_filtered.h5`. Output h5 file.

min_cells_per_gene.description: Type: `integer`, default: `0`. Minimum number of cells per gene
min_cells_per_gene.help_text: Type: `integer`, default: `0`. Minimum number of cells per gene.

keep_feature_types.description: Type: List of `string`, example: `Antibody Capture`, multiple_sep: `";"`. Specify which feature types will never be filtered out
keep_feature_types.help_text: Type: List of `string`, example: `Antibody Capture`, multiple_sep: `";"`. Specify which feature types will never be filtered out

nextflow input-output arguments.title: Nextflow input-output arguments
nextflow input-output arguments.description: Input/output parameters for Nextflow itself. Please note that both publishDir and publish_dir are supported but at least one has to be configured.

publish_dir.description: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory
publish_dir.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory.
